page.title: 11FARMING
page.content:
Agriculture
Approximately 90% of the study area is taken up by agricultural land.Most of this land is owned by the 15 farms marked on the map of the study area. Naturally there is also farmland owned by farms outside the study area.This was particularly evident in the village of Thorpe Audlin where only one of the four farms marked on the map still has a large area of farmland.Two of the others are now only small-holdings and the last is a private house,the land having been sold to farmers outside the study area. About 85% of the farmland is arable land,the rest being under grass.However,there is quite a variety of farming types in the area.Most of the farms do keep livestock mainly
